sn1.11:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn1.11:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
sn1.11:2.1: “Once upon a time, mendicants, a certain deity of the company of the Thirty-Three was amusing themselves in the Garden of Delight, escorted by a band of nymphs, and supplied and provided with the five kinds of heavenly sensual stimulation. On that occasion they recited this verse:
sn1.11:3.2: who don’t see the Garden of Delight!
sn1.11:3.3: It’s the abode of lordly gods,
sn1.11:4.1: When they had spoken, another deity replied with this verse:
sn1.11:5.2: the saying of the perfected ones:
sn1.11:5.4: their nature is to rise and fall;
